intro: Ophiorrhiza nervosa, commonly known as the veined marsh mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate or scrambling growth habit and is native to tropical regions of Asia. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with prominent venation, and its small, white or pale pink flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences. Ophiorrhiza nervosa thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its fibrous roots and adaptability to wet conditions make it an important component of tropical wetland ecosystems.
